channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Prince Harry was forced to dismiss Meghan Markle divorce rumors because...
item.description: Prince Harry's statement on rumors of his divorce from Meghan Markle looked forced, according to experts, as if to keep the buzz on as Harry was asked about the constant glare on their lives, not directly about the rumors of divorce. Experts said Harry pounced on the opportunity and mentioned the divorce as both Harry and Meghan were aware of the rumors and saw it as an opportunity to further their brand.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: TikTok faces looming ban in US as appeals court upholds divestment law
item.description: A US appeals court upheld a law mandating ByteDance to divest TikTok's US operations by January 19, 2025, or face a nationwide ban. The ruling intensifies US-China tensions, with TikTok planning a Supreme Court appeal. The decision's enforcement rests with the incoming Biden administration, impacting the social media landscape and US-China relations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mannheim knife attack: Stabbed German activist now faces legal action
item.description: Anti-Islam activist Michael Stürzenberger, recently attacked by an Afghan refugee in Mannheim where a policeman died, has been fined €3,600 for inciting hatred. A Hamburg court convicted him for remarks made at a 2020 rally, reducing a prior prison sentence due to the assassination attempt.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taylor Lorenz defends 'celebrating' Brian Thompson's murder: 'If you have watched...'
item.description: Former Washington Post reporter Taylor Lorenz defended her comments on the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, stating she was voicing the anger of many Americans facing healthcare system hardships. Lorenz said it was natural for anyone to feel happy because CEOs like Brian Thompson caused the deaths of many people by denying them their insurance coverage -- which is also violence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barack Obama accuses GOP of justice system misuse, public reacts: 'Bro lacks a mirror'
item.description: Former US President Barack Obama's remarks at the Democracy Forum sparked controversy. He criticized using the justice system against political rivals, drawing accusations of hypocrisy from Republicans citing Democrats' actions against Trump. Obama described the political landscape as a "doom loop" of polarization, with each side believing the other manipulates the system.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brian Thompson's killer is not a hitman? 3 reasons why experts think so
item.description: ​Experts who analyzed the CCTV footage claimed that though the killer was deft in handling the gun, he might not be a trained shooter because he had to fire many shots and shooting in the calf is not a sign of a professional hire, they think. Though the killer is yet to be traced, experts feel he was not a professional hitman and probably acted out of personal vendetta.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘I’m for America’: NYC Mayor Eric Adams leaves door open to potential GOP switch
item.description: NYC Mayor Eric Adams, a Democrat, hinted at a possible return to the Republican Party, emphasizing national unity over party lines. He praised bipartisanship and avoided criticizing Trump, sparking controversy among fellow Democrats. Adams faces federal charges, and Trump's potential influence on the case adds complexity. He plans to seek re-election as a Democrat.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Will Melania Trump never appear on the cover of any magazine as First Lady? Is it a dig at Jill Biden?
item.description: Melania Trump dismissed the snub by the magazines that she was not featured on the cover of any during her first stint as the first lady as she said she has many important things to do other than appearing on the cover of any magazine. "I think the life would not change for anybody if I am on the cover of any magazine," Melania said in a Fox interview in a veiled dig at Jill Biden who was the Vogue cover for August.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brian Thompson killing: UnitedHealthcare removes executive info from website after CEO's death
item.description: Days after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed in a targeted shooting, the company removed its executive list from its website. Thompson, 50, was fatally shot while walking to a conference in Midtown Manhattan. Investigators are probing links between the attack and Thompson’s role in the insurance industry, with evidence including engraved shell casings and a suspect using fake IDs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Ashamed to be an American': Teacher claims she was fired for posting anti-Trump content on social media
item.description: A Beverly Hills teacher, Joanie Garratt, alleges she was fired for criticizing pro-Trump student behavior and the former president on her private Facebook account. The school district denies firing her, claiming she was a substitute teacher whose assignment ended. The incident followed a pro-Trump rally where students allegedly harassed classmates, sparking debate about free speech and educator rights.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance explains how he and his 'closest friends in tech world' David Sacks became pro-Trump
item.description: JD Vance lauded David Sacks, a close friend and tech entrepreneur, for his transition to a staunch Trump supporter. Both initially critical of Trump in 2016, they united by 2020, viewing Trump as crucial against political and cultural 'insanity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Merciful President? After Hunter, Biden is considering pre-emptive pardons for these individuals
item.description: Among those reportedly being considered for pardons are Anthony S. Fauci, known for leading the US covid-19 response; retired General Mark A. Milley, former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who called Trump a "fascist"; Senator-elect Adam Schiff (D-California), who led Trump’s first impeachment; and ex-Congresswoman Liz Cheney (R-Wyoming), a prominent Republican critic of Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why is JetBlue announcing major route cuts to these US cities?
item.description: JetBlue Airways is restructuring its flight network in 2025, cutting routes from major hubs like JFK, Miami, and Austin to boost profitability. The airline will eliminate flights to destinations such as Houston, Paris, and London Gatwick, while also discontinuing Mint service on Seattle routes. This decision follows challenges in Florida's competitive market and anticipated aircraft groundings due to engine issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How 'AI Czar' David Sacks and tech bros helped Trump red-pill America
item.description: Silicon Valley’s conservative-libertarian contingent has long criticised Washington’s bureaucracy as a brake on innovation. Now, with Sacks at the helm, that contingent stands to reshape America’s AI, cryptocurrency, and digital policy landscape, with promises of deregulation and market-driven leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump says it's not possible for Barron to be a 'normal student' because...
item.description: In her first Fox interview since Donald Trump's re-election, Melania Trump discussed Barron's crucial role in Donald Trump's campaigning. ​He brought in so many young people of his generation... because nowadays the young generation doesn't sit in front of the TV anymore; they are all on the tablets, on their phones. It's incredible how Barron brought in success as he knew exactly who his father needed to contact and to talk to," Melania said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump confirms Pete Hegseth will not be replaced: 'Nothing can be done...'
item.description: ​"Pete Hegseth is doing very well. His support is strong and deep, much more so than the Fake News would have you believe. He was a great student - Princeton/Harvard educated - with a Military state of mind. He will be a fantastic, high energy, Secretary of Defense Defense, one who leads with charisma and skill. Pete is a WINNER, and there is nothing that can be done to change that!!!" Donald Trump posted on Truth Social.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Does Pete Hegseth have a drinking problem? What we know so far
item.description: Pete Hegseth, an Army veteran, has acknowledged using alcohol as a coping mechanism after his 2006 Iraq deployment, describing it as “self-medication” during a challenging reintegration into civilian life. In his 2016 book In the Arena and a 2021 podcast, he admitted to drinking heavily during that time. However, Hegseth credits his faith and wife Jennifer for helping him overcome these habits, stating, “Only by the grace of God was I able to undo that cycle.” Despite these admissions, he denies having a drinking problem, asserting he has never required or been advised to seek professional help.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy making 'naughty' and 'nice' lists. This is for...
item.description: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, leading Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), met with House Republicans to discuss budget cuts. They proposed "nice" and "naughty" lists for Congress members based on how they support DOGE's budget-slashing proposals. DOGE aims to cut the US federal budget by at least $2 trillion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Republicans are confident Kash Patel will be confirmed as FBI chief
item.description: Republican Senator John Cornyn and other influential figures within the GOP have publicly declared that Patel has the necessary votes for confirmation. This assertion reflects careful planning and strategic coordination among Senate Republicans, aimed at securing support for Trump’s nominee. Prominent senators, including Ted Cruz and Lindsey Graham, have also voiced their backing, bolstering the party’s confidence in the outcome.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Reddit thread on UnitedHealthcare CEO shot dead deleted as doctors celebrate murder
item.description: ​The moderators of the deleted Reddit post said that the post was removed as it was unproductive, "a time suck for the mods, without a good source, being brigade, arguably against Reddit's terms of service and featured too many inappropriate comments. It wasn't because of criticism of business practices. We criticize insurance business practices frequently here."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
